root.name: OOC_Stanton
root.label: Stanton
root.description: Stanton is a main sequence star of spectral type G. It is the central star of the Stanton system.

children.name: OOC_Stanton_4_Microtech
children.label: microTech
children.description: microTech is a frigid planet covered primarily in ice and snow, home to microTech corporation, known for their high-tech electronics and computing hardware.

children.name: OOC_Stanton_4b_Clio
children.label: Clio
children.description: A moon of microTech with tan-colored terrain and a thin atmosphere. Contains several small research outposts studying its unusual geological formations.

children.name: OOC_Stanton_4c_Euterpe
children.label: Euterpe
children.description: A small, bluish-gray moon of microTech with a thin atmosphere. Known for its extreme cold and icy surface, with several abandoned research facilities.

children.name: OOC_Stanton_4a_Calliope
children.label: Calliope
children.description: A reddish moon orbiting microTech with a thin atmosphere. Its surface features rugged terrain and is subject to frequent meteorite impacts.

children.name: OOC_Stanton_1_Hurston
children.label: Hurston
children.description: A super-Earth owned by Hurston Dynamics, heavily industrialized and exploited for its natural resources. The planet suffers from severe pollution and has large swathes of wasteland.

children.name: OOC_Stanton_1a_Ariel
children.label: Ariel
children.description: A barren, rocky moon orbiting Hurston with minimal atmosphere. Its surface is marked by impact craters and mining operations extracting valuable minerals.

children.name: OOC_Stanton_1d_Ita
children.label: Ita
children.description: A moon of Hurston with copper-colored terrain and steep mountains. Its surface is dotted with abandoned mining facilities and extraction sites.

children.name: OOC_Stanton_1b_Aberdeen
children.label: Aberdeen
children.description: A moon of Hurston with a distinctive reddish-orange appearance due to its acidic atmosphere and fungal biomes. Surface mining operations are prevalent despite harsh conditions.

children.name: OOC_Stanton_1c_Magda
children.label: Magda
children.description: A dusty moon of Hurston characterized by its dark brown surface and large canyons. Mining outposts exploit its rich mineral deposits despite difficult terrain.

children.name: OOC_Stanton_2_Crusader
children.label: Crusader
children.description: A gas giant planet surrounded by a thick layer of clouds. Home to Crusader Industries, known for their spacecraft manufacturing facilities located in the upper atmosphere.

children.name: OOC_Stanton_2a_Cellin
children.label: Cellin
children.description: A small rocky moon orbiting Crusader, with a thin atmosphere and surface covered in impact craters. Known for extreme temperature fluctuations between day and night.

children.name: OOC_Stanton_2b_Daymar
children.label: Daymar
children.description: A moon of Crusader with a sandy, desert-like appearance and breathable but thin atmosphere. Its surface features rolling dunes and rock formations.

children.name: OOC_Stanton_2c_Yela
children.label: Yela
children.description: An icy moon orbiting Crusader with a distinctive ring system. Known for its hidden smuggling outposts and abandoned research facilities.

children.name: OOC_Stanton_3_ArcCorp
children.label: ArcCorp
children.description: ArcCorp is a terrestrial super-Earth that has been completely covered in artificial structures. The planet is owned by the ArcCorp corporation and serves as an industrial manufacturing hub.

children.name: OOC_Stanton_3b_Wala
children.label: Wala
children.description: A gray, rocky moon of ArcCorp with minimal atmosphere. Its surface is heavily cratered and hosts several abandoned mining facilities.

children.name: OOC_Stanton_3a_Lyria
children.label: Lyria
children.description: A small, ice-covered moon orbiting ArcCorp, with cryovolcanic activity. Its surface contains valuable mineral deposits mined by numerous corporate outposts.
